Class FileRetrieveClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileRetrieveClient

  • public class FileRetrieveClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for creating and implementing functionality into the client.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.Socket client
      Client's socket which will be used to connect to the Server's socket
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream input
      ObjectInputStream object used to receive information from the server
      private java.lang.String messageFromServer
      message from the server shown as a String
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
      ObjectOutputStream object used to send information to the Server
      private java.util.Scanner reader
      Scanner object used to read the desired filepath from the console
      private java.lang.String serverName
      IP address of the server the client will connect to

      FileRetrieveClient(java.lang.String serverName)
      Class constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void closeConnection()
      called when the message from the server is "endit" (which is triggered by the client sending the server the same term).

      Attempts to connect the client's socket to the server socket.
      private void getStreams()
      attempts to connect the client's ObjectOutputStream with the server's ObjectInputStream and vice-versa.
      private void processConnection()
      Contains the logic that processes the information the client recieves from the server.

      When this method is called it will attempt to connect to the server, if/when it does it will connect the servers ObjectOutputStream to its own ObjectInputStream and vice-versa.
      void sendData(java.lang.String message)
      Sends data to the server

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileRetrieveClient

        public FileRetrieveClient(java.lang.String serverName)
        Class constructor. Sets the serverName equal to the constructors input parameter.
        Parameters:
        serverName - String containing the IP address of the server to connect to

    • Method Detail

      • runClient

        public void runClient()
        When this method is called it will attempt to connect to the server, if/when it does it will connect the servers ObjectOutputStream to its own ObjectInputStream and vice-versa. It will also call the processConnection() method

      • connectToServer

        private void connectToServer()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to connect the client's socket to the server socket. The port number is an arbitrary integer chosen to match the servers port number.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws in the event that client cannot connect to the specified IP-address

      • getStreams

        private void getStreams()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        attempts to connect the client's ObjectOutputStream with the server's ObjectInputStream and vice-versa.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws in the event that the streams cannot properly connect

      • processConnection

        private void processConnection()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Contains the logic that processes the information the client recieves from the server. In this case it reads in the file-path of the file the client wishes to receive the information from. It will continue to do this until the user inputs "endit" which will exit the while-loop and close the connection with the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws in the event that it cannot deserialize the input.readObject()

      • closeConnection

        private void closeConnection()
        called when the message from the server is "endit" (which is triggered by the client sending the server the same term). It closes the ObjectOutputStream, ObjectInputStream, and client socket.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String message)
        Sends data to the server
        Parameters:
        message - String containing the message to send to the server
